subject: Economics
subcategory: Economic Crises That Shook the World
title: The Asian Financial Crisis: Tiger Economies Humbled
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Asian Financial Crisis: Tiger Economies Humbled.

hook.text: Thailand ran out of dollars on July 2, 1997. It floated the baht.

buildup.text: Asian 'tiger' economies grew explosively through the 1990s, funded by cheap foreign loans.

discovery.text: When the baht collapsed, dollar-denominated debts became unpayable.

twist.text: The IMF demanded austerity in exchange for bailouts.

climax.text: The Asian crisis showed that hot money â€” short-term foreign capital.

punchline.text: Foreign money built the tigers. Foreign money also ate them.

quiz.question: What was the core vulnerability that caused the Asian financial crisis?
options: Countries borrowed in foreign currencies, making debts unpayable when local currencies collapsed
